185059748.review: We've had the BEST time playing this game. Kids older elementary through high school playing cooperatively together with mama. Success!

185027397.review: Coupled with the simple but amazing elements system, it's amazing how each level is distinct and I looked forward to seeing the next area. Lot's of replayability.

184893397.review:
I enjoyed this game, and, remarkably, so did my wife. She's not usually particularly into shooting things (though Gauntlet got her into it a bit), and now this is her favorite game and she's sad that we finished all of it, unlocked all the guys, etc. because now I can't find any other game that will scratch the same itch.

Other twin-stick shooters don't have the same quick decision-making aspect (which spell, what weaknesses do things have, do they have shields that will deflect that type of spell, etc.) - playing one of them after playing Nine Parchments is like "all I have to do here is shoot in the general direction of the bad guys, that's not very fun."

Magicka was a bit closer but the interface (having to fully reconfigure a spell for each cast) was offputting.

There are a few things that could be better - that it's so easy to fall off a cliff and die instantly is frustrating, especially when the camera viewpoint is sometimes obstinate about not even letting you see that the cliff is there. Area-of-effect circles obscuring the ground so you can't see if there's a hole is a real pain (that could be remedied by making the circles "drop off" when there's an edge). The camera behavior in general is often frustrating (being shot by something that you can't see *even if both players are on that edge of the screen* because the camera just doesn't want to look over there in that particular area is a recurring annoyance).

But so many things done right make this still such a strong winner that now it's hard to find a new game to play. We need a sequel (perhaps with better camera and visibility behavior!)

184871711.review: Приятный сказочный клон Маджики от создателей Trine, выполненный в схожей стилистике и с той же мягкой иронией. В то время как оригинал больше про затяжные комбинации и черный юмор, Найн Парчментс больше дает игроку возможность просто приятно провести вечер с геймпадами перед телевизором, открывая ачивки и персонажей под красивые музыку и рисовку.

184478057.review: Jogo mto divertido (mais ainda entre amigos). Fiquei surpreso com a inteligência dos inimigos. O cenário tbm é mto bonito.

184320537.review: This is a really fun, approachable couch co-op twin-stick shooter. It has a fun theme and lots of collectable items, upgradable skills, and unlockable characters, that encourages replaying earlier levels. It has rock-paper-scissor game mechanics that encourages the team to work together when fighting monsters, and it is fairly forgiving when players screw up. We have had a lot of laughs with this one, and it feels like we accomplished something, even when we only managed to unlock a hat of stun-resistance.

184032513.review: Amazingly good local-coop game! The people of Trine know how to make a good game!!! Get 4 friends you want to campaign with, and just buy it. Full price, half price.. it's worth it.

184007375.review:
반복되는 전투로 인한 지루함, 밸런스 조절 실패한 난이도가 심각하며 매번 접속할 때마다 캐릭터의 옷 색이 변하는데 멀티에서 같은 캐릭을 하고 있으면 비슷하게 보이다보니 누가 누군지 알아보기 힘든 때가 많습니다.(이름이 있음에도 제대로 안 보임) 또한 아군도 공격할 수 있기 때문에 안그래도 난이도가 어려운데 이 때문에 더욱 힘들게 됩니다.
노멀 모드도 어려워서 이지 모드로 선택을 시도했음에도 난이도가 전혀 쉬워지지 않습니다.
그래픽 및 BGM은 정말 아름답지만 트라인을 즐겁게 플레이했던 만큼 실망이 큽니다.

183866928.review:
You know what's mental? The way life sometimes hands you these perfectly flawed gems that you can't help but love, like that weird uncle who tells inappropriate jokes at Christmas but makes the best pudding you've ever tasted. That's Nine Parchments for you.

Let me tell you a story. Last week, I'm sitting there with my kid, right, playing this gorgeously crafted magical romp that looks like Disney had a baby with a fireworks factory. We're bouncing spells off each other like we're in some demented wizard circus, and half the time I'm accidentally freezing her character solid while she's gleefully electrocuting mine. It's absolute chaos, and we're loving every second of it.

But here's the thing - it's like that time I bought a fancy coffee machine. Looks brilliant, makes a decent cuppa, but it's got so many buttons and settings that you end up just pressing the same three over and over because who's got time to experiment when you just want your morning fix? That's what happens with the spells in this game. Sure, there's loads of them, but you'll find your favorites and stick to them like a pensioner to their favorite chair at the pub.

Playing solo? That's about as fun as going to a party where you don't know anyone and the host has disappeared. The game will batter you about like a ping pong ball in a tornado until you either give up or get lucky. But bring a friend along, and suddenly it's like adding vodka to a boring party - everything gets more entertaining, even if someone occasionally gets hurt.

The level design is gorgeous but linear as a Roman road. Imagine walking through an art gallery where someone's installed guide rails - you can see all these lovely bits off to the sides, but you're basically being shoved forward like a shopping trolley with a dodgy wheel. And don't get me started on the camera in co-op mode. It's like trying to take a group selfie where someone always ends up getting their head cut off, except here they actually die after 5 seconds off-screen.

Look, if this game were a person, it'd be that friend who's absolutely brilliant at karaoke but only knows three songs. You'll have a blast every time you hang out, but you'll wish they'd learn some new material. The bosses are like those bouncers who look tough but are actually teddy bears - it's the regular punters you need to watch out for.

But you know what? Despite all its quirks - or maybe because of them - Nine Parchments is like that local pub that's rough around the edges but serves a proper pint. It's not perfect, but when you're there with good company, you wouldn't want to be anywhere else.

Nine Parchments is like a wizard's apprentice: Full of potential, occasionally sets things on fire, but charming enough to get away with it.

183837940.review: Bought this game on sale and it's been a blast. Playing solo or Co-Op locally. My old laptop can even run the game and it still looks beautiful. Fun mechanics. Fun idea for a game.

183836142.review:
This game needs to be marked more clearly that it is an controller game.  It is so frustrating without, makes it really difficult to enjoy.  Tutorial level doesn't have the clearest of directions, Once you get the hang of it, it does seem to be quite repetitive but that makes it difficult for new players to pick it up.  Not for single-players.

I was drawn in by the art style and marketing, and find myself a little disappointed.
